intro: Ervatamia continentalis, commonly known as the European sand thistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as coastal dunes and roadsides. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a distinctive lobed shape, while its yellow flowers bloom in summer. Ervatamia continentalis is known for its ecological importance, providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a host plant for certain insect species.
